Material: -If you find this spreadsheet valuable, I hope you'll visit Applesorcerer.com, where I've started publishing content for the DM's Guild and DriveThruRPG.
Value:
-Items in orange and italic are suggested prices; e.g., what a player might pay at a magical supplies store. These are a little subjective. (Also includes the word "(suggested)" now. Thanks, Vimes Carrot!) 
-Items with no marked price ("-") must be harvested by the caster or acquired via special means.
-Items in normal black are the minimum value of the material that the spell requires in order to be successful!
Spell: -You seem like a person who likes materials. I have a whole podcast exploring the incredible true stories behind the materials we work with outside the realm of fantasy! I'd appreciate it if you visit episodictable.com to give it a listen.
Notes:
-If you have any suggestions, feel free to add a note directly to this spreadsheet! I'm interested in keeping this an up-to-date and useful resource for fellow DMs. Thanks!

2020-09-23: I have Kobold Press' Deep Magic in hand, but I'm so busy lately that I probably won't add those 600 spells (!) till sometime in 2021. Still happy to hear your suggestions, though!

2020-11-08: Added artificer spells and "Official Spells w/o Material Components" sheet.

Bitumen is essentially the same thing as pitch -- a kind of tar or asphalt, sticky and thick petroleum. But the official books refer to them as separate materials, and so it is here, too.
Edit: J.F. Aster points out that pitch can be a plant product, and bitumen is specifically the petroleum product! Thanks!

Material: Twig from a tree that has been struck by lightning
Notes: IMHO this is a great example of a material spell component that can be an entire adventure hook. How many trees struck by lightning are you aware of? What if you were in a foreign land? Could someone familiar with the territory lead you to such a tree -- or even call lightning down for you? What kind of person would that be?
